result.execSummary:
The defendant Sidney Triggs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges including the mandatory DNa  surcharge.  To be paid out of up  to 25% of prison wages.  Any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment is to be entered.

Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program but does qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Progarm after serving one half (1/2) Initial Confinement.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.
No illegal drugs.  No controlled substances without valid prescription.  No contact with drug community.

Cognitive behavior therapy.
Conditions of Extended Sueprvison to be determined by DOC, but to include: those as listed.
Alcohol and drug assessment.  Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Random urine screens.  No positive results. Absolute sobriety.

Defendant ordered to submit a DNa smaple if not already done.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.

records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Sidney Triggs in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Document ordered sealed by the court.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 4 years, consecutive to any other sentence. 
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 2 years with credit for 1 day
time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 years.
Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:  
 
*
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*Absolute sobriety.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, out of up to 25% prison wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does not qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program but does qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 1/2 initial confinement.
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Sidney Triggs in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-09-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Sidney Triggs in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Sidebar held.  Court allows one final adjournment.  Plea hearing scheduled for 06-17-2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant Sidney Triggs in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Sidney Triggs in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 3/27/14.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Sidney Triggs in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Sidney Triggs in custody.  Catelin Autumn Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.
